author: A. Faizur Rahman
description: The Supreme Court will be well within its rights to lay down the procedure of divorce as per Koranic principles
title: Triple talaq not fundamental to Islam

author: Chris Lee
description: Quantum computing benchmark looks at fundamental limit of computer, not speed.
title: Bigger is better: Quantum volume expresses computer’s limit

description: The Supreme Court asked the All-India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) on Wednesday whether the body could ask qazis to ascertain from every woman prior to preparing the nikahnama whether she would give consent to her husband having the right to instant divorce through triple talaq.
title: SC: Will women’s nod be taken for right to talaq? - Times of India

author: Joe Skrebels
description: What's on the next Direct's menu? Mostly Arms, with a dash of Splatoon seasoning.
title: Arms-Focused Nintendo Direct Coming Tomorrow - IGN

author: ESPNcricinfo staff
description: India will tour the West Indies for five ODIs and one T20 international in June and July, with the trip beginning almost immediately after the Champions Trophy final in England.
title: India to tour West Indies right after Champions Trophy

author: Ben Kew
description: Chelsea Manning will reportedly receive free health care and remain on active duty after being released from prison.
title: Chelsea Manning to Remain on Active Duty, Receive Free Health Care after Release - Breitbart

author: Alex Gilyadov
description: Robert Zemeckis, Matthew Vaughn, and Sam Raimi are reportedly all on Warner Bros.' shortlist to direct The Flash.
title: The Flash: Robert Zemeckis, Matthew Vaughn, Sam Raimi Up to Direct - IGN

author: Frances Martel
description: The international community should act against Venezuela's socialist dictatorship as a matter of principle, argues Diego Arria.
title: More Than 'Chaos': Terror Ties Make Venezuela Direct Threat to USA, Former UN Security Council President Says - Breitbart

description: A 69-year-old British landlord, who instructed agents not to let his properties to people from India and Pakistan, is facing legal action, UK's human rights watchdog has said.
title: UK landlord faces legal action for ban on Indian tenants - Times of India

author: John D. McKinnon
description: U.S. regulators are set to move forward Thursday with a plan that would blow up the rules that have governed the internet in recent years and essentially start anew, opening the door to fundamental shifts in consumers’ online experiences.
title: FCC’s Internet-Rules Revamp Likely to Bring Big Changes Online
